metadata.title: CVE-2021-3572 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in python-pip in the way it handled Unicode separators ingit references. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to installa different revision on a repository. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data integrity. This is fixed in python-pip version21.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm2
python-pip-whl - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm2
python3-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-pip package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm2').
